title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.zh: 天下之至柔，馳騁天下之至堅。
passages.en: (The universal use (of the action in weakness of the Dao)) The softest thing in the world dashes against and overcomes the hardest;

passages.zh: 無有入無間，吾是以知無為之有益。
passages.en: that which has no (substantial) existence enters where there is no crevice. I know hereby what advantage belongs to doing nothing (with a purpose).

passages.zh: 不言之教，無為之益，天下希及之。
passages.en: There are few in the world who attain to the teaching without words, and the advantage arising from non-action.
